Package it.polimi.ingsw.clients.viewer

Class CLI

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.clients.viewer.CLI
All Implemented Interfaces:
UI, PropertyChangeListener, Runnable, EventListener
public class CLI extends Object implements Runnable, UI
Class CLI creates the Command Line Interface which is on of the two ways to play the game
Author:
Alessio Piovesan, Pier Giorgio Prosperi, Matteo Salamone

    method getResponse asks what the player wants to do when he tries to store a resource in the warehouse but this resource can not be added. 1: discards the resource and gives additional faith track points to other players 2: rearrange the warehouse by using actOnResponse 3: lets the player choose another shelf 4: goes back

    • run

      public void run()
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable

    • propertyChange

      public void propertyChange​(PropertyChangeEvent evt)
      Method propertyChange is part of the Observer Pattern that can react to Model's changes. TEMPORARYLEADERCARDS: used to choose the two initial leader cards FIRSTOP: starts the game if single player, else handles the resources NEXTPLAYER: used for single player mode to decide the next player between Lorenzo and the actual player LORENZOACTIONPRINT: prints action from Lorenzo REDCROSSMOVE: moves the pawn on the faith track NEXTACTION: calls method nextAction, used to ask the player what is his next action MARKETBUFFER: buffer for the market COSTCARDDEV: resources needed to buy a Development Card GAMEID: prints the game's id WRONG: used in case of a wrong input from the player
      Specified by:
      propertyChange in interface PropertyChangeListener
      Parameters:
      evt - of type PropertyChangeEvent
      See Also:
      nextAction(), resourcesHandlerMarket(List), payForCardDev(List)

    • payForCardDev

      private void payForCardDev​(List<Pick> cost)
      Method payForCardDev is used to handle the payment of a Development Card.
      Parameters:
      cost - of type List of Pick
      See Also:
      DrawerCLI.showWarehouse(List), DrawerCLI.showStrongBox(Map)

    • actualPayment

      private void actualPayment​(List<Pick> cost, Colours color)
      Parameters:

      color - resource to be payed now

      payForCardDev(List)

    • showStatus

      private void showStatus()
      Method showStatus is a method used to give a player the option to view his current game's status at any given time 1: shows the warehouse 2: shows the strongbox 3: shows his Development Cards 4: shows his Leader Cards 5: shows the faith track 6: back to choosing action
      See Also:
      DrawerCLI.showWarehouse(List), DrawerCLI.showStrongBox(Map), DrawerCLI.showLibrary(List), DrawerCLI.showMyCardLeader(CardLeader[]), DrawerCLI.showFaithTrackSingle(Checker)

    • chooseAction

      private void chooseAction​(String menu)
      Method chooseAction is used to record and execute player's choice for his next action 1: Activate Production 2: Pick resources from the market 3: Buy a dev Card 4: Activate a Leader Card 5: Show Status
      Parameters:
      menu - is the list of possible actions
      See Also:
      startProd(), marketMove(), chooseCardDev(), wakeALeader(), showStatus()

      method startProd is used to activate the production of a player's board

      Parameters:
      card - is a development card

    • toWarehouse

    • resourcesHandlerMarket

      private void resourcesHandlerMarket​(List<Colours> bufferMarket)
      Method resourcesHandlerMarket is the method used to handle resources that have been chosen from the market. Resources can be discarded or stored in the warehouse. For every discarded resource other players get an additional Faith point which moves them further on the faith track
      Parameters:
      bufferMarket - are the resources that have just been chosen from the market
      See Also:
      resourcesDestination(Colours, String, String)

    • resourcesDestination

      private int resourcesDestination​(Colours colour, String s, String s2)
      Method resourcesDestination lets the player decide the destination of a resource
      Parameters:
      colour - is one of the possible colours
      s - is a param of string type
      s2 - is a param of string type
      Returns:
      an int type that is the player's decision

    • askId

      public void askId()
      Method askId asks the player if he already has a game to join by requesting the game ID previously provided by another player who created the match. In case the player does not have a game ID and wants to create a new match, an ID will be provided to him.
      Specified by:
      askId in interface UI

      private void marketMove()

      Returns:

    • chooseCardDev

      private void chooseCardDev()
      Method chooseCardDev is the method used whenever a player wants to buy a Development Card with his resources. Whenever the player cannot buy any Dev Card, this method will warn him.
      See Also:
      canBuyAnyCardDev(List)

      private int pickSlot​(CardDev card)
      Method pickSlot is used to ask the player where he wants to store his most recently bought Dev Card in the library.
      Parameters:
      card - is a development card
      Returns:
      the list of remaining development cards

    • prepareResForWarehouse

      private void prepareResForWarehouse​(Colours colour)
      Parameters:
      colour - is a colour
      See Also:
      prepareResForWarehouseS(Colours, int), prepareResForWarehouseM(Colours, int)

    • prepareResForWarehouseM

      private void prepareResForWarehouseM​(Colours colour, int qnt)
      Method prepareResForWarehouseM (for multiplayer game) is the method used to place resources in the warehouse. The same method is used whenever a resource is taken from the warehouse by subtracting the value instead of adding it
      Parameters:
      colour - is a colour
      qnt - is the quantity of the selected resource

    • prepareResForWarehouseS

      private void prepareResForWarehouseS​(Colours colour, int qnt)
      Method prepareResForWarehouseS (for single player game) is the method used to place resources in the warehouse. The same method is used whenever a resource is taken from the warehouse by subtracting the value instead of adding it
      Parameters:
      colour - is a colour
      qnt - is the quantity of the selected resource

    • checkAdd

      private boolean checkAdd​(int lvl, Pick add)
      Method checkAdd check if a certain pick can be added to a certain shelf of a warehouse
      Parameters:
      lvl - the shelf
      add - the pick to add to that shelf
      Returns:
      of boolean type, if can be added or not

    • actOnResponse

      private int actOnResponse​(Colours colour, int response, int lvl)
      method actOnResponse is the method used to handle the warehouse whenever a resource cannot be added and the player wants to rearrange the warehouse. The method asks for the starting shelf and for the destination of a resource so it can move it.
      Parameters:
      colour - is a colour
      response - tells if the resource can be added to the warehouse or not
      lvl - is the warehouse shelf level, either 1,2 or 3
      Returns:
      the warehouse shelf level

    • moveAllOtherFT

      private void moveAllOtherFT​(List<Colours> colours, int i)

    • getResponse

      private int getResponse()
      method getResponse asks what the player wants to do when he tries to store a resource in the warehouse but this resource can not be added. 1: discards the resource and gives additional faith track points to other players 2: rearrange the warehouse by using actOnResponse 3: lets the player choose another shelf 4: goes back
      Returns:
      the new player selection

    • getWarehouseShelfLvl

      private int getWarehouseShelfLvl()
      Method getWarehouseShelfLvl check if the player's input is an existent shelf of a warehouse
      Returns:
      of type int is a shelf of the warehouse
